title: Project-Based Mathematics Learning Design for Real-World Problem Solving

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level foundational mathematics concepts (equations, functions, statistics, etc.)
context.additional_context: Small-Group Activities Focused on Cultivating Mathematical Problem-Solving Skills Applicable to Workplace Environments for Professionals

learning_goals: Learners can define mathematical problems that may arise in real workplace environments and propose solutions using the PBL (Problem-Based Learning) approach.
Learners can integrate soft skills such as collaboration, time management, and resource utilization during the project execution process.
Learners can effectively present PBL outcomes through mathematical modeling, data visualization, and report writing.

resources: Digital Collaboration Tools (Google Workspace, Miro, etc.)
Open-Source Software for Mathematical Problem Solving (GeoGebra, Python, etc.)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
